meanings.definition: The act or process of making something modern or up-to-date.
meanings.sent1: The modernisation of the old building included adding new technology and sleek designs.
meanings.sent2: The company's modernisation of their website attracted more customers.
meanings.sent3: The modernisation of the kitchen turned it into a high-tech cooking paradise.
meanings.sent4: Her modernisation of the traditional dance routine brought a fresh and exciting twist.
meanings.sent5: The modernisation of the city skyline with futuristic skyscrapers was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: The state of being modern or up-to-date.
meanings.sent1: The modernisation of the town brought a sense of progress and innovation.
meanings.sent2: She embraced the modernisation of fashion trends and always dressed in the latest styles.
meanings.sent3: The modernisation of the classroom with interactive whiteboards made learning more engaging.
meanings.sent4: His modernisation of the traditional music genre created a new sound that captivated audiences.
meanings.sent5: Living in a house with modernisation such as smart appliances and automated systems is convenient.
